{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/title|has_signaling_NaN}}
{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++11
|dcl1=
static const bool has_signaling_NaN;
|dcl2=
static constexpr bool has_signaling_NaN;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::has_signaling_NaN}} is {{c|true}} for all types {{tt|T}} capable of representing the special value "Signaling [[enwiki:NaN|Not-A-Number]]". This constant is meaningful for all floating-point types and is guaranteed to be {{c|true}} if {{c|1=std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::is_iec559 == true}}.
